content.text: Now let me check the CSS file to understand the styling:

name: update_plan
arguments: {"plan": [{"status": "in_progress", "step": "Review current website files and structure"}, {"status": "pending", "step": "Modify HTML content to reflect White House branding and messaging"}, {"status": "pending", "step": "Update CSS styling to match White House color scheme and typography"}, {"status": "pending", "step": "Adjust JavaScript functionality as needed"}, {"status": "pending", "step": "Ensure all content is appropriate for a government website"}]}

content.text: Now I'll create a plan to transform this generic landing page into a White House .gov landing page:

name: file.edit
arguments: {"path": "index.html", "instructions": "Replace the generic landing page content with White House branding. Update the title, header, navigation, hero section, features, and footer to reflect White House content and styling. Change the logo to \"The White House\", update navigation links to standard White House sections, modify hero content to reflect presidential messaging, change features to government services, and update footer with appropriate government information."}

output:

content.text: I'll now modify the website to make it a White House .gov landing page. Let me start by updating the HTML content:
